p: Climate change adaptation (preparedness) and mitigation (prevention) can occur through policies and interventions at international, national, and local levels. In December 2015, 176 countries and the European Union signed the Paris Agreement, a treaty under the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change committed to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions, enhanced adaptation efforts, and alignment of financial activities with climate-resilient development goals. 16, 17 This treaty begins to address the driving forces and pressures contributing to climate change that can be managed through national policies in signatory countries, such as those concerning greenhouse gas emissions, energy, transport, agriculture, and land use.
